business.headline: Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: At 1:12 pm, the Sensex was down 1051.88 points to 76,261.90, and the Nifty fell 321.15 points to 23,060.45. Most broader market indices were also in the red as volatility spiked sharply.

New Income Tax Bill expected soon: Here's what taxpayers can expect The new bill aims to make direct tax laws simpler, reduce litigation, and remove ambiguities in the current system. Experts believe it will be easier to understand, more user-friendly, and free of unnecessary complexities.

Sacked Infosys trainees share ordeal after mass termination: 'This is inhumane'The sacked trainee employees, who were onboarded after 2.5 years of wait, were called in batches of 50 starting from 9.30 am on February 7. They were escorted to a room guarded by security and bouncers where they were made to sign a mutual separation letter.

PM Modi inaugurates India Energy Week 2025, outlines green energy targetsPrime Minister Narendra Modi virtually launched India Energy Week 2025, reaffirming India's commitment to green energy. He announced plans to add 500 GW of renewable capacity and outlined ambitious 2030 sustainability goals, citing India's strong track record over the past decade.

Explained: Why Zomato share price plunged over 5% todayZomato stock price: Shares of the company have been under pressure ever since global brokerage firm Jefferies raised concerns over rising competition in the quick commerce space.

India 1st G20 country to achieve Paris Agreement goals, says PM Narendra ModiPrime Minister Narendra Modi also outlined various other green energy targets to achieve by the year 2030, calling them ambitious yet possible given the excellent track record in the past 10 years.

Why Eicher Motors shares dropped 7% despite record Royal Enfield sales in Q3Eicher Motors stock price fell nearly 7% in early trade despite reporting a 18% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit.

Nokia picks Intel's AI and data centre leader Justin Hotard as new CEOJustin Hotard, who will take up the position on April 1, is currently the executive vice president and general manager of Data Center & AI Group at Intel, according to the chipmaker's website.
Stock market sell-off hurting your portfolio? Here's what you can doThe ongoing stock market sell-off has hit retail investors hard, dragging portfolios deep into the red.

Sensex falls nearly 200 points, Nifty struggles in early tradeStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 197.45 points to 77,114.35 at 9:29 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 62.90 points to trade at 23,318.70. All the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

entertainment.headline: Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

Mukesh Khanna on Ranveer Allahbadia row: Blacken his faceActor Mukesh Khanna has criticised YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia for making explicit remarks on Samay Raina's show, calling for strict punishment to deter such behaviour.

Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

Squid Game 3 to have 6 episodes. Fans say 'they better be 2 hours long'Fans of Squid Game are eagerly awaiting the third season. However, the revelation of the season having only six episodes has left many fans disappointed.

Solo Leveling Season 2: Animation peaks as Jinwoo defeats dungeon bossThe latest episode of Solo Leveling peaked with its brilliantly animated fight sequence. In the episode, titled Don't Look Down on My Guys, Sung Jinwoo clashed with Karlgargan.

Uorfi Javed defends friend Samay Raina amid calls for his arrestUorfi Javed slammed people demanding jail time for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina after Allahbadia's obscene joke on India's Got Latent went viral.

Samay Raina in Seattle as India's Got Latent and Ranveer Allahbadia face backlashIndian stand-up comedian Samay Raina recently performed in Seattle, as controversies surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia and India's Got Latent stirred social media discussions in India.

Rakhi Sawant asks forgiveness for Ranveer AllahbadiaActor Rakhi Sawant shared a message for fans amid the Ranveer Allahbadia controversy. She requested all to 'forgive' the YouTuber for his recent crass jokes on Samay Raina's show.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Singer Charlie Puth to Kanye West for selling Swastika T-shirts: I beg you to stopSinger Charlie Puth 'begged' Kanye West to stop after he sold Swastika T-shirts on his website. Kanye's move sparked concern about his 'incredibly dangerous' claims.

Ankita Lokhande tears down Rozlyn Khan's claims about Hina Khan's cancer: So cheapAnkita Lokhande slammed Rozlyn Khan for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle. She called out Rozlyn Khan's claims 'cheap'.

Bryan Adams's Australia concert cancelled due to overflowing sewageSinger Bryan Adams's Australia concert was cancelled due to an overflowing sewage issue caused by a "large blockage" of fat, grease, and rags. Adams apologised to fans and assured them that tickets would be refunded.

Arijit Singh takes Ed Sheeran on scooter ride in his hometown in West Bengal. WatchSinger Arijit Singh took pop singer Ed Sheeran on a scooter ride in West Bengal's Jiaganj. The English singer-songwriter ditched heavy security and enjoyed his ride through the streets of West Bengal.

Comedian Kapil Sharma meets Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan YadavKapil Sharma met Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in Bhopal and shared glimpses of their meeting on social media. He also expressed his gratitude.

BB 18's Chum Darang shares cryptic post after Elvish Yadav's racist remarksChum Darang shared a cryptic post on Instagram, advocating for respect and equality. This came after Elvish Yadav made racist remarks about her.

general news.headline: Right time to come to India: PM to French business leaders at Paris CEO ForumPM Modi welcomed the CEO Forum report and hailed the mantra of "innovate, collaborate and elevate" that is strengthening the India-France partnership.

Jasprit Bumrah was 'okay' for Champions Trophy, but selectors didn't want to take riskJasprit Bumrah was reportedly deemed 'okay' by the National Cricket Academy, but the BCCI selection committee decided not to take a risk with the star pacer for the upcoming Champions Trophy. Bumrah was omitted frpm the squad for the tournament on Tuesday, February 11.

Just not confident of HAL: IAF chief's strong words for Tejas-maker over delaysA video from the ongoing Aero India show, in which Air Chief Marshal AP Singh is seen expressing disappointment with the delays in the deliveries of the Tejas Mk1A fighter jets, has gone viral. "At the moment, I am just not confident of Hal," he is heard telling officials of the Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd.

Build better product: Sam Altman to Elon Musk amid OpenAI takeover bidElon Musk and Sam Altman, who co-founded OpenAI in 2015 and later clashed over its leadership, have been in a longstanding feud over the company's direction.

Band, Baaja, Instagram: Why Indian couples are hiring wedding social media managersIndia is witnessing a rising trend of hiring social media managers, the digital ninjas who not only help couples go viral but also capture precious moments that might otherwise be missed, and then turn it all into a stunning digital wedding diary and engaging social media content.

Ayodhya Ram Temple's chief priest dies after hospitalisation due to strokeAcharya Satyendra Das was hospitalised on Sunday after suffering a brain stroke. His cremation will take place in Ayodhya on Thursday.

Maghi Purnima snan begins at Kumbh, thousands take holy dip amid tight securityThe Maghi Purnima snan is the fourth bathing event at the Maha Kumbh. The sacred bath will also mark the end of the month-long Kalpavas and around 10 lakh kalpvasis will start leaving the fair area.

PM meets JD Vance's family in Paris, Vice President calls him gracious, kindVance's post came in response to PM Modi's earlier post on X, in which the latter recalled the joyous moments as he joined the birthday celebrations of US Vice President's son Vivek.

Captain America's pick for next Avenger? Anthony Mackie says Shah Rukh KhanActor Anthony Mackie, who will next be seen in Captain America Brave New World, calls Shah Rukh Khan 'the damn best' and wants him as an Avenger. The film is set to hit theatres on February 14.

Amid 90-hr work week debate, Andhra's big work from home push: Can empower womenAndhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu announced his government's Work From Home (WFH) initiative targeting women in the workforce. The initiative, part of the state's IT & GCC policy 4.0, plans to enhance their participation through work models that foster better work-life balance and employment opportunities across cities, towns, and rural areas.

Unnatural sex by man with wife without her consent not an offence: High CourtSexual intercourse between a husband and his wife, who is not below 15, cannot be termed as rape as the absence of the woman's consent for an unnatural act loses its importance, the Chhattisgarh High Court said.

Rahul Gandhi summoned by Lucknow court over 2022 remarks against ArmyThe complaint was filed by former director of the Border Roads Organisation (BRO), who alleged that Rahul Gandhi's statements during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in December 2022, were derogatory and defamed the Indian Army.
Have mercy: Jaya Bachchan says cinema being targeted, appeals to governmentJaya Bachchan urged Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to provide solutions to help the film industry survive.

From the India Today archives (2017) | Modi-Trump: Friends with benefits?With PM Narendra Modi and US president Donald Trump set to meet, it's time to re-evaluate their 'jhappi' in 2017 and the diplomatic give-and-take that happened

With Elon Musk by his side, Trump gives DOGE more power to make staff cutsElon Musk and his son, X Æ A-Xii, whom the tech billionaire refers to as Little X, stood alongside Donald Trump in the Oval Office as the President signed the order to give DOGE more power to shrink the federal workforce by making large staff cuts.

Which planet is she on? Priyanka Gandhi on Nirmala Sitharaman's inflation remarkThe Union Finance Minister's statement of food inflation under the Narendra Modi government dropping to 5.3% in 10 years, down from 11% during the UPA regime, drew flak from Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

IND vs ENG, 3rd ODI: India's final chance to fine-tune side before Champions TrophyIndia will play one last game against England before flying out for the Champions Trophy. With Jasprit Bumrah being ruled out of the upcoming ICC event, the final match of the series is the last opportunity for the Indian team to get their house in order before flying out to Dubai.

Gaza ceasefire ends if Hamas does not release hostages by Saturday: NetanyahuBenjamin Netanyahu warned that the Gaza ceasefire deal will end if hostages are not released by Saturday afternoon, adding that the military will return to intense fighting.

Punjab in limbo for 4 months as cabinet meetings delayed for Delhi pollsSince October 2024, there has been an inordinate delay in holding any cabinet meetings due to Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann and his top state ministers being preoccupied with election campaigning in Delhi for AAP.

Even after 57 years, Deendayal Upadhyaya's death remains a mysteryFifty-seven years after Pandit Deendayal Upadhyaya's mysterious death, the circumstances remain unclear. On his death anniversary, we remember his major contributions enduring contributions to Indian political thought continue to influence the nation's discourse.

Shampoo, geyser, tub: Mobile bathroom's free shower service for Mumbai womenThe high-tech van is equipped with five mobile phones and two clothes dryers. Each bathroom offers facilities for hand wash, body wash, has a tap, bucket, shampoo, shower and geyser facility, and a tub.

Russia releases American teacher Marc Fogel after US envoy visitThe development comes as Trump seeks to set the foundation for peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine to end Moscow's three-year invasion of Ukraine.

Metro fare hike decided by Centre, not state: Siddaramaiah slams BJP amid rowThe Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) said the minimum fare will remain at Rs 10 for trips up to two kilometres. Journeys longer than 25 kilometres will cost Rs 90 from February 9.

Urvashi Rautela says 'hard to assess' Dabidi Dibidi criticism: It's done so nicelyActor Urvashi Rautela defended the choreography of Daaku Maharaaj song Dabidi Dibidi. She insisted that there's 'nothing out of the ordinary" with the steps and that the song caters to Balakrishna's fans.

No politics, my brother Pawan Kalyan is there: Chiranjeevi at Hyderabad eventMegastar Chiranjeevi reconfirmed his decision to stay out of politics at a recent event in Hyderabad. He addressed his recent meetings with political leaders at a public event.

Pop girl group XG take their 'The first HOWL' World Tour to Latin-America  XG, a dynamic hip-hop/R&B-inspired girl group, is set to captivate audiences in Latin America with their inaugural concerts in Brazil and Mexico. As they continue their world tour, XG unveils a groundbreaking project, 'XDM Unidentified Waves,' that redefines their music and solidifies their global appeal.

Sobhita Dhulipala blushes as Naga Chaitanya calls her by nickname at Thandel bashNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala attended the grand success bash of Thandel on Tuesday. An endearing interaction between the couple was the highlight of the evening.

sports.headline: Manchester City boss Guardiola struggles to explain late collapse vs Real MadridManchester City boss Pep Guardiola struggled to find words to explain his side's late collapse against Real Madrid in the Round Of 16 qualifier of the UEFA Champions League on February 11. City let a 2-1 lead slip to lose the match 2-3 and hand the advantage to Madrid.

Bumrah was omitted frpm the squad for the tournament on Tuesday, February 11.

IND vs ENG, 3rd ODI: Will Arshdeep get a chance before Champions Trophy?IND vs ENG: India might want to have a look at fast bowlers Arshdeep Singh and all-rounder Washington Sundar in the third ODI against England before heading to Dubai for the Champions Trophy. This will be the final chance for India to test their bench strength.

IND vs ENG, 3rd ODI: India's final chance to fine-tune side before Champions TrophyIndia will play one last game against England before flying out for the Champions Trophy. With Jasprit Bumrah being ruled out of the upcoming ICC event, the final match of the series is the last opportunity for the Indian team to get their house in order before flying out to Dubai.

No place for Siraj? Gambhir slammed for big call in Champions Trophy squadIndian cricket fans were seen going after head coach Gautam Gambhir-led team management for not selecting Mohammed Siraj in the final squad for ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Siraj was named as a non-travelling reserve for the tournament.

Champions Trophy 2025: Mitchell Starc pulls out, Steve Smith to lead AustraliaMitchell Starc has decided to withdraw from the Champions Trophy 2025 as Australia announced their squad for the event on Wednesday, February 12. Steve Smith will be leading the Aussies in the event as they will miss their big 3 pacers.

Fans question Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission from India squad Champions Trophy: Fans weren't happy after Yashasvi Jaiswal was left out of the Indian squad after being given a chance in only a solitary ODI against England at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur.

Varun Chakravarthy in Champions Trophy squad, Yashasvi, Siraj and Dube in reservesIndia wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy has been selected in India's final squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, replacing Yashasvi Jaiswal, who has been moved to reserves.

Haris Rauf ruled out of tri-series, expected to be fit for Champions TrophyStar Pakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf has been ruled out of the ongoing tri-nation series against Pakistan and New Zealand. However, the Pakistan Cricket Board is expecting him to be fully fit for the Champions Trophy 2025.

Bumrah ruled out as India finalise spin-heavy Champions Trophy squadChampions Trophy: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah couldn't recover in time from his back injury and missed out on a berth in the Indian squad for the upcoming eight-time tournament. Varun Chakravrthy was added to the squad in place of Yashasvi Jaiswal, who was named as one of the three travelling reserves.

Steve Smith will be leading the Aussies in the event as they will miss their big 3 pacers.

Varun Chakravrthy was added to the squad in place of Yashasvi Jaiswal, who was named as one of the three travelling reserves.

Kapil Dev's suggestion for Rohit, Kohli: Talk to Gavaskar, DravidFormer cricketer Kapil Dev said that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should watch videos of their good knocks and talk to players like Sunil Gavaskar and Rahul Dravid to return to their very best.

Riyan Parag breaks silence on Ananya Pandey and Sara Ali Khan search controversyIndia cricketer Riyan Parag has broken his silence on his search history controversy from 2024 about Bollywood actors Ananya Pandey and Sara Ali Khan.

Kapil Dev backs Mohammed Shami to be at his menacing best in Champions TrophyLegendary India all rounder Kapil Dev has backed Mohammed Shami to be at his usual best in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. He also shared his views on the possibility of Jasprit Bumrah missing the tournament.

Pakistan vs South Africa Live Streaming: When and where to watch? Pakistan and South Africa will lock horns in the last and final league match of the ongoing tri-series on Wednesday, February 12 at the National Stadium in Karachi. Both teams lost to New Zealand earlier in the series.

There is cricket left in me: Ajinkya Rahane after heroic hundred in Ranji TrophyMumbai captain Ajinkya Rahane scored a stunning second innings hundred in the Ranji Trophy quarter-final. After securing the win against Haryana, Rahane roared that there was still some cricket left in him.

Sunil Gavaskar makes big Champions Trophy prediction for Virat Kohli and team IndiaLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has made a big prediction for star India batter Virat Kohli and team India for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Ex-coach reveals Champions Trophy 2017 blunder from Virat Kohli and Anil KumbleFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has revealed the major blunder committed by Virat Kohli and Anil Kumble-led team management during the ICC Champions Trophy 2017.

Losing 0-3 to India is fine? Ben Duckett clarifies comments after backlashEngland batter Ben Duckett has offered clarification after stating that the team did not care about losing to India 0-3 as long as they won the Champions Trophy. Duckett clarified his statement on X.

Virat Kohli is still the king: Gayle backs batter to do well in Champions TrophyLegendary West Indies batter Chris Gayle has backed Virat Kohli to do well in the Champions Trophy. Gayle has said if Kohli is able to do well in the ICC tournament, it will prolong his ODI career.

Champions Trophy 2025: England, Bazball look for spark in bid to win 1st titleThe Bazballing England will have their work cut out during the Champions Trophy 2025 as they look to bounce back from poor performances in the ODI World Cup and T20 World Cup in 2023 and 2024 respectively. Buttler and co. will be tasked with a few problems during their campaign in Pakistan.

Rishabh Pant's adorable interaction with young fan: Fast bowling daalte ho?India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was seen having an adorable chat with a fan as he signed his T-shirt along with Rohit Sharma and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Shardul, Rahane star as Mumbai outclass Haryana to seal semi-final berthRanji Trophy 2024-25: Mumbai defeated Haryana by 152 runs in the quarterfinal to keep their title defence alive. Captain Ajinkya Rahane's second-innings hundred and Shardul Thakur's all-round show were the highlights of Mumbai's dominant win in Kolkata.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
